question: Which of the following is called GDP Deflator?
option1: Ratio of nominal to real GNP
option2: Ratio of nominal to real CPI
option3: Ratio of nominal to real GDP
option4: Ratio of real to nominal GNP
answer: Ratio of nominal to real GDP
explanation: In economics, the GDP deflator (implicit price deflator) is a measure of the level of prices of all new, domestically produced, final goods and services in an economy in a year. It is Ratio of nominal to real GDP.
